metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4121 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11.3 isaffected. Safari before 11.1 is affected. iCloud before 7.4 on Windows isaffected. iTunes before 12.7.4 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11.3 isaffected. watchOS before 4.3 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit"component. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a craftedweb site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
